[[Chris Halliwell]] }} A '''Whitelighter''' is a [[fictional character]] featured on the [[WB Television Network|WB]] television series ''[[Charmed]]''. These beings are former human mortals who are given a second chance at life in order to serve under an angelic group known as [[Elders (Charmed)|The Elders]] as guardian angels for good witches and other future Whitelighters. ==Description== Whitelighters are the "guardian angels" of good witches and future Whitelighters.{{cite web|title=Charmed: Secrets and Guys|url=http://www.tv.com/shows/charmed/secrets-and-guys-1057/|publisher=TV.com|accessdate=27 September 2011}}{{cite web|title=Charmed: Love Hurts|url=http://www.tv.com/shows/charmed/love-hurts-1064/|publisher=TV.com|accessdate=27 September 2011}} Mortal charges are not known or seen to have much interaction with their whitelighters. They watch over their charges and intervene when necessary to help them along their path and keep them safe; they can also be called by their charges. They can constantly hear the lives of their charges in their heads,{{cite web|title=Charmed: Siren's Song|url=http://www.tv.com/shows/charmed/siren-song-179885/|publisher=TV.com|accessdate=27 September 2011}} and if one of them calls their Whitelighter's name, he/she can usually show up at a moment's notice. Whitelighters are people who were generally good people that have died. They are given the choice to become Whitelighters and given the [[Whitelighter#Powers and abilities|powers of a Whitelighter]] instead of moving on to the [[afterlife]]. Their bodies are replicas of their former human bodies, but are composed of orbs which are described as white lights (hence the term Whitelighter) that have a healing ability to them. If struck by a power that would usually kill a mortal (for example, an energy ball or particle acceleration), their bodies will explode into orbs then reform relatively unharmed;{{cite web|title=Charmed: House Call|url=http://www.tv.com/shows/charmed/house-call-206379/|publisher=TV.com|accessdate=14 September 2011}} they can, however, be knocked unconscious.{{cite web|title=Charmed: Charmed Again (Part 2)|url=http://www.tv.com/shows/charmed/charmed-again-2-73475/|publisher=TV.com|accessdate=14 September 2011}} Because their orbs make their bodies immortal, the only sure way to kill a Whitelighter is to poison them with a [[Darklighter]] arrow. ==Hybrids== The type of Whitelighter hybrid seen on-screen have been the child of a witch and a Whitelighter.{{cite web|title=Charmed: Charmed Again (Part 1)|url=http://www.tv.com/shows/charmed/charmed-again-1-73474/|publisher=TV.com|accessdate=27 September 2011}}{{cite web|title=Charmed: The Day the Magic Died|url=http://www.tv.com/shows/charmed/the-day-the-magic-died-212377/|publisher=TV.com|accessdate=14 September 2011}}{{cite web|title=Charmed: Oh My Goddess (Part 1)|url=http://www.tv.com/shows/charmed/oh-my-goddess-1-236597/|publisher=TV.com|accessdate=14 September 2011}} Whitelighter-witch hybrids have been shown to possess both the powers of a Whitelighter, which range from Orbing to Healing, and also witch abilities, such as spellcasting and potion making.{{cite web|title=Charmed: Chris-Crossed|url=http://www.tv.com/shows/charmed/chris-crossed-272565/|publisher=TV.com|accessdate=14 September 2011}} Within the series, [[Paige Matthews]] is the first Whitelighter hybrid seen on-screen. She is also the first hybrid to display a magical power that has been affected by both her witch and Whitelighter halves. As a witch of Warren blood and a Charmed One, Paige received the power to "[[Telekinesis|move things with her mind]]", which is one of the three powers belonging to her ancestor [[Melinda Warren]]. However, since she is also a Whitelighter, her Telekinesis became [[Paige Matthews#Telekinetic Orbing|Telekinetic Orbing]], which is the ability to call for an object and orb it to the caller. Throughout the series' television run, there have been eight Whitelighter hybrids shown on-screen. {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- !colspan="3"|List of Hybrids |- ! Name !! A Whitelighter acts in the service of [[Elders (Charmed)|The Elders]] who bestow these souls with their new angelic powers. Description |- | colspan="6" style="background:#7cb8d3"| |- | Orbing || 1x10 - "[[Wicca Envy]]" || 8x22 - "Forever Charmed" || A teleporting ability unique to Whitelighters as it allows them to travel between various supernatural worlds, including the magically guarded realm of The Elders often called "Up There" in the show.{{cite web|title=Charmed: Blinded by the Whitelighter|url=http://www.tv.com/shows/charmed/blinded-by-the-whitelighter-8964/|publisher=TV.com|accessdate=27 September 2011}} |- | colspan="6" style="background:#7cb8d3"| |- | Healing || 1x10 - "Wicca Envy" || 8x19 - "[[The Jung and the Restless]]" || The power to restore an individual to full health or an object to pristine condition.{{cite web|title=Charmed: Wicca Envy|url=http://www.tv.com/shows/charmed/wicca-envy-1053/|publisher=TV.com|accessdate=27 September 2011}} In the ''Charmed'' series, certain magical powers are attached to emotional triggers, although all powers can be affected by the user's emotions. For healing, the emotional trigger is love. Whitelighters can only use their healing powers on humans and not animals or demons.{{cite web|title=Charmed: Magic Hour|url=http://www.tv.com/charmed/magic-hour/episode/2802/|publisher=TV.com|accessdate=27 September 2011}}{{cite web|title=Charmed: Sleuthing With the Enemy|url=http://www.tv.com/shows/charmed/sleuthing-with-the-enemy-8319/|publisher=TV.com|accessdate=27 September 2011}} |- | colspan="6" style="background:#7cb8d3"| |- | Hovering || 1x14 - "[[Secrets and Guys]]" || 8x21 - "[[Gone with the Witches]]" || The supernatural power to rise in the air a few feet, similar to levitation but slower and just in one place, unlike flight. Whitelighters and Elders have the power to hover, and sometimes use it to meditate in a swirl of orbs.{{cite web|title=Charmed: Size Matters|url=http://www.tv.com/shows/charmed/size-matters-73477/|publisher=TV.com|accessdate=27 September 2011}} |-| colspan="6" style="background:#7cb8d3"| |- | colspan="6" style="background:#7cb8d3"| |- | Sensing || 2x21 - "[[Apocalypse Not]]" || 8x22 - "Forever Charmed" || This is a supernatural power which grants a Whitelighter a magical awareness of a charge's location and physical well being. This power enables a Whitelighter to hear the "call" of their charges whenever they are in need, allowing them to go the charge when they need them most. A Whitelighter's charge must not always vocally call out to them when they are in need. The sensing power allows the Whitelighter to instantly hear a charge's inner call whenever the charge is in immediate danger, which is, more often than not, life-threatening.{{cite web|title=Charmed: Still Charmed & Kicking|url=http://www.tv.com/shows/charmed/still-charmed-and-kicking-425939/|publisher=TV.com|accessdate=27 September 2011}} |- | colspan="6" style="background:#7cb8d3"| |- | Glamouring || 3x07 - "[[Power Outage (Charmed)|Power Outage]]" || 8x04 - "[[Desperate Housewitches]]" || A number of Whitelighters possess the power to glamour their identity by creating an illusion around their body to appear as another individual.{{cite web|title=Charmed: Power Outage|url=http://www.tv.com/shows/charmed/power-outage-4038/|publisher=TV.com|accessdate=27 September 2011}} |- | colspan="6" style="background:#7cb8d3"| |- | Photokinesis || 3x15 - "[[Just Harried]]" || 8x13 - "[[Repo Manor]]" || The ability to create and manipulate light. It is a power that is most commonly possessed by angelic beings, like Whitelighters and the Elders. This power is usually demonstrated by controlling orbs of light, rather than manipulating actual light.{{cite web|title=Charmed: Just Harried|url=http://www.tv.com/shows/charmed/just-harried-26852/|publisher=TV.com|accessdate=14 September 2011}} |} == Modern usage == ''"Whitelighter"'' is also a term used in the [[Neopagan]] community, particularly amongst [[Wiccans]] to describe those who see [[Deity]] only in the "good", but not in things unpleasant or unappealing.
